___strict-ssl.description: Whether or not to do SSL key validation when making requests via https.

___user-agent.description: Sets the User-Agent for each request made.

___directory.description: The directory from which bower should run. All relative paths will be calculated according to this setting.

___timeout.description: he timeout to be used when making requests in milliseconds.

___interactive.description: Makes bower interactive, prompting whenever necessary

___color.description: Enable or disable use of colors in the CLI output.

___https-proxy.description: The proxy to use for https requests.

___cwd.description: The directory from which bower should run. All relative paths will be calculated according to this setting.

___proxy.description: The proxy to use for http requests.

___ca.description: The CA certificates to be used, defaults to null. This is similar to the registry key, specifying each CA to use for each registry endpoint.

___storage.description: Where to store persistent data, such as cache, needed by bower.

___register.description: The URL to use when registering packages.

___search.description: An array of URLs pointing to read-only Bower registries. A string means only one. When looking into the registry for an endpoint, Bower will query these registries by the specified order.

___publish.description: The URL to use when publishing packages.

___tmp.description: Where to store temporary files and folders

___json.description: A file path to the Bower configuration file
